availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Allen Stone Montgomery (Marion County, Kentucky, farmer. )

body.p: Boyle and Marion County, Kentucky, carpenter and farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Martha Pipes Montgomery. Father of William H. Montgomery, Elias A. Montgomery, Margaret Montgomery, Nancy Montgomery, and Elizabeth Montgomery. Carpenter in Boyle County in 1850. Farmer in Marion County in 1860. Owned three enslaved persons in Marion County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Boyle County, District 1, p. 328B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Marion County, District No. 2, p. 757.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Marion County, District No. 2, p. 497A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Marion County, Lebanon Precinct, p. 65B.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll #994047, Marion County Births.
"Allen S. Montgomery (1818-1895)," Find A Grave, Memorial #99569150, accessed May 18, 2022, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/99569150/allen-s-montgomery.
